oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Intrinsic unsharpness and approximate repeatability of quantum measurements
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Carmeli, C.
Heinonen, T.
Toigo, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The intrinsic unsharpness of a quantum observable is studied by introducing the notion of resolution width. This quantification of accuracy is shown to be closely connected with the possibility of making approximately repeatable measurements. As a case study, the intrinsic unsharpness and approximate repeatability of position and momentum measurements are examined in detail.
Comment: Proposition 22 has been modified and some minor corrections has been made
